name: Rice
description: The seed of the grass species Oryza sativa (Asian rice), 95 percent of the world's rice crop is eaten by humans

name: Wheat
description: Wheat is a grass widely cultivated for its seed, cereal grain that is a staple food and started being cultivated 10,000 years ago

name: Sorgum
description: Flowering plants in the grass family (Poaceae), It's low in fat, but high in protein, fiber, B vitamins.

name: Teff
description: Teff is a seed sized grain that is a staple crop of Ethiopia. People In India would know of Ragi, a close cousin of Teff

name: Sweetcorn
description: called sugar corn and pole corn, is a variety of maize grown for human consumption with a high sugar content

name: Brown Rice
description: Brown rice is a whole grain rice with the inedible outer hull removed. Brown rice is more nutrient-dense

name: Black quinoa
description: Quinoa is a grain-like seed with a mild, nutty flavor.Our Black Quinoa is naturally dark colored.

name: Amarnath
description: Amaranth grain can also be used to extract amaranth oil, a pressed seed oil with commercial uses.

name: Oat
description: The nutrient composition is well-balanced,good source of carbs and fiber,including fiber beta-glucan
